TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit CommonSecurityDescriptor extends System.Security.AccessControl.GenericSecurityDescriptor

Docs.summary: Represents a security descriptor. A security descriptor includes an owner, a primary group, a Discretionary Access Control List (DACL), and a System Access Control List (SACL).

MemberSignature.Value: public CommonSecurityDescriptor (bool isContainer, bool isDS, System.Security.AccessControl.RawSecurityDescriptor rawSecurityDescriptor);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool isContainer, bool isDS, class System.Security.AccessControl.RawSecurityDescriptor rawSecurityDescriptor) cil managed

Docs.param: if the new security descriptor is associated with a container object.
if the new security descriptor is associated with a directory object.
The object from which to create the new object.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the underlying security descriptor from which the new <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.RawSecurityDescriptor> object is created contains `null` for its discretionary access control list (DACL), a single access control entry (ACE) that allows everyone full access (AEFA) is added to the DACL. If an application modifies the DACL of a security descriptor to which an AEFA ACE has been added, the AEFA ACE is persisted with the DACL when that DACL is persisted.
This can result in an application unintentionally allowing access to principals. Because of this, an application should check for the existence of an AEFA ACE and remove it before modifying any security descriptor.

MemberSignature.Value: public CommonSecurityDescriptor (bool isContainer, bool isDS, string sddlForm);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool isContainer, bool isDS, string sddlForm) cil managed

if the new security descriptor is associated with a directory object.
The SDDL string from which to create the new object.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified Security Descriptor Definition Language (SDDL) string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the underlying security descriptor from which the new <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.RawSecurityDescriptor> object is created contains `null` for its discretionary access control list (DACL), a single access control entry (ACE) that allows everyone full access (AEFA) is added to the DACL. If an application modifies the DACL of a security descriptor to which an AEFA ACE has been added, the AEFA ACE is persisted with the DACL when that DACL is persisted.
This can result in an application unintentionally allowing access to principals. Because of this, an application should check for the existence of an AEFA ACE and remove it before modifying any security descriptor.

The offset in the `binaryForm` array at which to begin copying.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified array of byte values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the underlying security descriptor from which the new <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.RawSecurityDescriptor> object is created contains `null` for its discretionary access control list (DACL),a single access control entry (ACE) that allows everyone full access (AEFA) is added to the DACL. If an application modifies the DACL of a security descriptor to which an AEFA ACE has been added, the AEFA ACE is persisted with the DACL when that DACL is persisted.
This can result in an application unintentionally allowing access to principals. Because of this, an application should check for the existence of an AEFA ACE and remove it before modifying any security descriptor.

MemberSignature.Value: public CommonSecurityDescriptor (bool isContainer, bool isDS, System.Security.AccessControl.ControlFlags flags, System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier owner, System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier group, System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl systemAcl, System.Security.AccessControl.DiscretionaryAcl discretionaryAcl);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool isContainer, bool isDS, valuetype System.Security.AccessControl.ControlFlags flags, class System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier owner, class System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier group, class System.Security.AccessControl.SystemAcl systemAcl, class System.Security.AccessControl.DiscretionaryAcl discretionaryAcl) cil managed

Docs.param: if the new security descriptor is associated with a container object.
if the new security descriptor is associated with a directory object.
Flags that specify behavior of the new object.
The owner for the new object.
The primary group for the new object.
The System Access Control List (SACL) for the new object.
The Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) for the new object.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the underlying security descriptor from which the new <xref:System.Security.AccessControl.RawSecurityDescriptor> object is created contains `null` for its discretionary access control list (DACL), a single access control entry (ACE) that allows everyone full access (AEFA) is added to the DACL. If an application modifies the DACL of a security descriptor to which an AEFA ACE has been added, the AEFA ACE is persisted with the DACL when that DACL is persisted.
This can result in an application unintentionally allowing access to principals. Because of this, an application should check for the existence of an AEFA ACE and remove it before modifying any security descriptor.

Docs.summary: Gets values that specify behavior of the object.
Docs.value: One or more values of the enumeration combined with a logical OR operation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the discretionary access control list (DACL) for this object. The DACL contains access rules.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If this property is set to `null`, a single access control entry (ACE) that allows everyone full access (AEFA) is added to the DACL. If an application modifies the DACL of a security descriptor to which an AEFA ACE has been added, the AEFA ACE is persisted with the DACL when that DACL is persisted.
This can result in an application unintentionally allowing access to principals. Because of this, an application should check for the existence of an AEFA ACE and remove it before modifying any security descriptor.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the primary group for this object.
Docs.value: The primary group for this object.

Docs.summary: Gets a Boolean value that specifies whether the object associated with this object is a container object.
Docs.value: if the object associated with this object is a container object; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a Boolean value that specifies whether the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) associated with this object is in canonical order.
Docs.value: if the DACL associated with this object is in canonical order; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a Boolean value that specifies whether the object associated with this object is a directory object.
Docs.value: if the object associated with this object is a directory object; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets a Boolean value that specifies whether the System Access Control List (SACL) associated with this object is in canonical order.
Docs.value: if the SACL associated with this object is in canonical order; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the owner of the object associated with this object.
Docs.value: The owner of the object associated with this object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void PurgeAccessControl(class System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier sid) cil managed

Docs.param: The security identifier for which to remove access rules.
Docs.summary: Removes all access rules for the specified security identifier from the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) associated with this object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks To avoid unintentionally allowing access to principals, applications should check for the existence of an allow everyone full access (AEFA) access control entry (ACE) and remove it before modifying a DACL.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void PurgeAudit(class System.Security.Principal.SecurityIdentifier sid) cil managed

Docs.param: The security identifier for which to remove audit rules.
Docs.summary: Removes all audit rules for the specified security identifier from the System Access Control List (SACL) associated with this object.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetDiscretionaryAclProtection (bool isProtected, bool preserveInheritance);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetDiscretionaryAclProtection(bool isProtected, bool preserveInheritance) cil managed

Docs.param: to protect the DACL from inheritance.
to keep inherited access rules in the DACL; to remove inherited access rules from the DACL.
Docs.summary: Sets the inheritance protection for the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) associated with this object. DACLs that are protected do not inherit access rules from parent containers.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetSystemAclProtection (bool isProtected, bool preserveInheritance);
.method public hidebysig instance void SetSystemAclProtection(bool isProtected, bool preserveInheritance) cil managed

Docs.param: to protect the SACL from inheritance.
to keep inherited audit rules in the SACL; to remove inherited audit rules from the SACL.
Docs.summary: Sets the inheritance protection for the System Access Control List (SACL) associated with this object. SACLs that are protected do not inherit audit rules from parent containers.
Gets or sets the System Access Control List (SACL) for this object. The SACL contains audit rules.
